comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Missouri_State_Capitol says: "The fifth Capitol (which is at the current site) was completed in 1840, for approximately $350,000, with some claiming that there were bribes and kickbacks. This also burned on February 5, 1911 when it was struck by lightning. " "A total of 69 architecture firms submitted for the competition, from which a short list of 11 was chosen. Tracy & Swarthout from New York was ultimately selected." The new capitol was completed in 1917 and occupied in 1918. See www.flickr.com/photos/99491151@N00/3804356607/ for recent pictures

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: TVL1970 has twice misspelled the name Swarthout in the tags he added.
